situation.title: Possibilities and obligations of foreigners when entering the CZ
situation.meta_description: Rules and recommendations for entering the territory of the Czech Republic.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

 Foreigners are not allowed to come to the Czech Republic for reasons other than necessary. Necessary reasons include a trip to work and to do business, a profession, a trip back to their places of residence, a trip to leave the Czech Republic, provision of care for children, relatives, or animals, necessary trips to medical facilities, and social services facilities, participation in a wedding or funeral, participation in education, including internships and exams. More information can be found at current measures. 

Currently, the following rules for entry into the Czech Republic are being applied. Without any conditions, it is possible to travel to the Czech Republic only from countries that are on the list of countries with a low risk of infection. If you have been in a country with a medium, high, or very high risk of infection for more than 12 hours in the last 14 days (this category includes all countries not listed above), the following rules apply to you. 

A journey from countries with a medium risk of infection (orange):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or a PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronic form and you may use this form).

A journey from countries with a high risk of infection (red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or a PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronic form and you may use this form).
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

A journey from countries with a very high risk of infection (dark red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or a PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic (certification can be either in paper or electronic form and you may use this form).
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

There are exceptions to these conditions. It does not apply, for example, to transit within 12 hours, international transport workers (holders of the certification), children under 5 (upon the arrival a 5-day quarantine is obliged), cross-border workers and students (certified as a worker or student), for those EU citizens who have undergone covid-19 in the last 90 days and had isolation ( with a certificate from a doctor) and for family members, companion of Czech citizens traveling with a Czech citizen, who have a diplomatic note issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (certificate of covid-19 disease and isolation in a red or dark red country). Additional exceptions can be found in the current measure.

For travel from all three groups of countries (orange, red, dark red), it is mandatory to wear an FFP2 respirator without an exhalation valve for 14 days after arrival in the Czech Republic. Additionally, before traveling, read the general rules for wearing protective equipment indoors and outdoors.

Foreigners from countries outside the EU who are not on the list of countries with a low risk of infection are prohibited from entering the Czech Republic. There are exceptions to this ban, which you will find in the current measure.

The exact conditions for entry into the territory of the Czech Republic, including exceptions, can be found in English clearly in the table of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic.

We also recommend you check the conditions of accommodation.

In case of doubts or questions, please call the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic: +420 974 801 801  (Mon - Thu: 8:00 - 16:00 and Fri: 8:00 - 12:00). Or by e-mail: cestovani.covid19@mvcr.cz. Information is available in the Czech and English languages.
